tournament.name: Ultimate Guard Pioneer Open Â– Fanfinity

decks.notes: This Aggro deck focuses on utilizing Arclight Phoenix and other spells to quickly attack the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The deck includes cheap spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, while also including control elements like Spell Pierce to protect your creatures. The deck aims to be fast and efficient, overwhelming opponents with a strong early game and card advantage through Treasure Cruise. It also features some versatile cards like Brazen Borrower for tempo plays and Torch the Tower for removal.

This aggressive Selesnya deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while efficiently deploying threats like Skyclave Apparition and Elite Spellbinder. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, then finish the game with powerful spells like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful spells and creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and use them to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes several cheap spells to help enable this strategy, along with card draw to help dig through the deck for more spells. The deck also includes some control elements like counterspells and removal to help protect and clear the way for the Phoenix to attack. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and fast-paced, utilizing the Arclight Phoenix as a powerful finisher.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures from the deck and control the board through a variety of removal spells and counters. The deck aims to establish board presence with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Overlord of the Floodpits while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. The mana base is designed to support a variety of different colored spells and ensure consistent casting of powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana quickly and efficiently. With cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field multiple times, the goal is to cast big spells such as Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo with cards like Strict Proctor and Bala Ged Recovery. By assembling the pieces of the combo while controlling the board, the deck aims to win the game through powerful spells and overwhelming mana advantage.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to control the board by removing threats with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also putting pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Unstoppable Slasher. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of mana-fixing lands to ensure a consistent mana base for casting spells efficiently.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying small creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp up mana, while disrupting opponents with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Skyclave Apparition and Enduring Innocence provide removal options, while Aven Interrupter and Werefox Bodyguard offer additional pressure. Collected Company helps to refill the board with creatures, maximizing the deck's aggressive strategy. The Selesnya color combination provides a mix of efficient creatures and disruption, aiming to overwhelm opponents with a fast and powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful creatures and various removal spells. By utilizing cards like Zur, Eternal Schemer and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production and proper color fixing. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to outlast the opponent by effectively controlling the board and ultimately overwhelming them with its powerful creatures and spell choices.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence and applying constant pressure on the opponent. Utilizing low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Novice Inspector, along with powerful cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Gleeful Demolition provide removal options. The deck includes a Companion in Jegantha, the Wellspring to further enhance its aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on maximizing green devotion to generate massive amounts of mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Leyline of the Guildpact. This mana is used to power out powerful creatures like Old-Growth Troll and Polukranos Reborn, while also enabling big spells like Storm the Festival and Finale of Devastation. The deck also includes key support cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Archdruid's Charm to maintain board presence and disrupt opponents' strategies. By ramping quickly and overwhelming the opponent with threats, this deck aims to win through aggressive creature beats.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Greasefang Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence and finish off the opponent quickly. It focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while using cards like Fear of Missing Out and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to generate advantage. The deck also includes other powerful threats like Bloodtithe Collector and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure. By efficiently using its resources and timing its combos right, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a mix of hand disruption spells and removal spells. It aims to control the board through targeted removal like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck includes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodletter of Aclazotz to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's black-heavy requirements, with lands like Mutavault and Concealed Courtyard providing the necessary colors.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Duress to strip away opponent's resources while deploying threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni. It also includes efficient removal options like Torch the Tower and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a strong board presence, while also having some late-game reach with cards like Fear of Missing Out and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Additionally, the inclusion of land options like Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway provide flexibility and consistency in mana base.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo potential of Relic of Legends and Acererak to quickly generate value and overwhelm the opponent. By including a companion like Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck can guarantee a consistent mana base to support its game plan. With a mix of ramp creatures, card draw engines, and legendary threats, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and maintain board presence throughout the game. Overall, the deck seeks to outpace opponents and capitalize on synergy between its cards to secure victory.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to quickly ramp up mana for powerful plays. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria disrupt opponents' spells, while Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter provide removal options. Collected Company allows for additional creature advantage, while Enduring Innocence and Werefox Bodyguard offer protection. The combination of efficient creatures, disruption, and mana acceleration aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying a fast and aggressive board presence through efficient creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Aven Interrupter. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponents' spells while Archon of Emeria slows down their mana development. Collected Company allows for explosive creature summons, while Skyclave Apparition deals with opposing threats. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Werefox Bodyguard and Enduring Innocence to control the board. The mana base is designed to consistently cast the deck's spells while Boseiju, Who Endures provides protection for crucial spells.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing out Arclight Phoenix and using cheap spells to trigger its ability to come back to the battlefield from the graveyard. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and filtering spells to maintain card advantage and find the necessary combo pieces. The inclusion of some removal spells and counterspells helps protect the Phoenix and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The land base includes a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana sources while also providing additional benefits.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. The deck also includes creatures with evasion like Picklock Prankster and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of counterspells like Spell Pierce and removal spells like Lightning Axe helps to control the board and protect your threats. The overall strategy is to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while utilizing the graveyard as a resource for recurring threats.

This deck focuses on quickly powering out Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard using spells like Opt, Lightning Axe, and Fiery Impulse. It also includes cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to disrupt the opponent's strategy and dig through the deck for more spells. With efficient card draw from Treasure Cruise and filtering abilities from cards like Sleight of Hand, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and aggressive creatures like Brazen Borrower. The inclusion of Artist's Talent and Profit's Eidetic Memory provide additional utility and versatility to the deck.

This deck focuses on rapidly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with constant pressure. It includes a mix of cheap spells, card draw, and removal to allow for efficient spell casting and ensure the Phoenix can return to the battlefield multiple times. The inclusion of cards like Picklock Prankster and Brazen Borrower provides additional flexibility and disruption, while also maintaining the overall aggressive strategy of the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes various cantrips and cheap spells to enable this strategy, while also incorporating disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Lightning Axe to control the board. Additionally, the deck features a mix of card draw and spell recursion to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful instant/sorcery spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Heartless Act. The creatures in the deck provide additional pressure and can help close out the game quickly, especially when backed up by the powerful land package that includes Mutavault and Field of Ruin. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of card advantage and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of aggressive Human creatures. By using cards like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, you can quickly build a board presence and boost your creatures' power. By utilizing cards like Brave the Elements and Get Lost, you can protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's strategies. Additionally, the land base in this deck is optimized to support the Human tribal theme and ensure consistent mana sources for your aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice mechanics and creating value through recurring creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Mayhem Devil. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push while generating card advantage with cards like Deadly Dispute. Ygra, Eater of All is a powerful threat that can end games quickly, and the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional flexibility and consistency. The deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and sacrificing creatures for value.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Lotus Field card to generate large amounts of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and abilities. It includes cards that can untap Lotus Field, search for specific lands, and draw additional cards to find combo pieces. The deck also includes protection against opponent's spells with cards like Strict Proctor. The goal is to create a mana advantage and then cast game-winning spells like Emergent Ultimatum or Omniscience. It aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo potential and strategic gameplay.

The deck focuses on generating infinite mana through the interaction between Lotus Field and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, allowing for powerful plays such as casting Emergent Ultimatum or Omniscience. It also includes multiple ways to tutor for key pieces, protect the combo with Strict Proctor, and generate card advantage with Pore Over the Pages and Archdruid's Charm. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and win the game through overwhelming mana advantage and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By running a mix of efficient creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, it aims to put early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The addition of powerful finishers like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse ensures that the deck has multiple ways to close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of removal and disruption. By playing powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, as well as efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out adds extra versatility and flexibility to the deck's strategy. With a strong mana base and access to powerful lands like Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway, the deck is well-equipped to apply pressure and control the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Using cards like Heartfire Hero, Monastery Swiftspear, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, the deck seeks to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and mana acceleration. By combining cheap creatures with powerful burn spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage, this deck can put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The land base also supports this aggressive strategy with fast mana sources like Blackcleave Cliffs and Sulfurous Springs.

This aggressive Rakdos deck aims to overwhelm opponents with low-cost creatures and pump spells, backed up by burn spells and combat tricks. The deck's key strategy is to play aggressively, constantly pressuring opponents and quickly depleting their life total before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and power to the deck, allowing for more aggressive plays and potentially overwhelming opponents even faster. With a mix of fast creatures, pump spells, and burn, this deck aims to quickly close out games before opponents can mount a defense.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Elvish Mystic and Aven Interrupter, while also utilizing cards like Skyclave Apparition for removal. The deck also includes Collected Company to help find additional threats quickly. The mana base supports the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and creature lands to ensure smooth early game plays.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game through using powerful enchantments and removal spells while utilizing the abilities of Zur, Eternal Schemer to fetch key cards from the deck. The Overlords serve as strong beaters while the rest of the cards focus on disruption, ramp, and fixing for mana. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent while setting up a win condition through efficient use of resources and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes cheap spells like Consider and Opt to dig for more cards and fuel the graveyard, along with removal spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to control the board. Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass provide card advantage and help maintain momentum. Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent offer additional sources of damage and disruption. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting and recycling of Arclight Phoenix.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap instants and sorceries to trigger Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Picklock Prankster. The deck runs a selection of low-cost spells to help enable Arclight Phoenix's return and dig through the library for key cards like Treasure Cruise. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive threats and direct damage spells, while maintaining card advantage through efficient card draw and selection. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent and smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively bring out Arclight Phoenix and other creatures to deal damage to the opponent. Spells like Consider, Opt, and Treasure Cruise help with card draw and digging for key pieces, while removal spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe clear the way for attacks. Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent provide additional value and synergize with the deck's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, spells, and direct damage to secure victory in a fast-paced, aggressive manner.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, utilizing cheap cantrips and removal spells to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. By casting multiple spells in a turn, the deck aims to bring back multiple Phoenixes early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes some alternative win conditions and disruption spells to handle various threats and maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, while also utilizing other aggressive creatures like Picklock Prankster. The deck includes a mix of cheap spells, card draw, and removal to fuel the graveyard and control the board. Artist's Talent and Profit's Eidetic Memory offer additional card advantage, while Stormcarved Coast and the various lands provide mana fixing and utility. The goal is to quickly pressure opponents with evasive threats and finish them off before they can stabilize.

The main strategy of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm opponents with quick and efficient creatures and burn spells. Key cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Lightning Helix help maintain pressure on the opponent while Boros Charm and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide versatile removal options. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while utilizing cards like Skewer the Critics and Monstrous Rage for additional damage. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Dimir Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Steamcore Scholar and Duelist of the Mind, while also drawing cards and gaining card advantage with Treasure Cruise and Profit's Eidetic Memory. It also includes some evasive threats like Mutavault and Ledger Shredder to pressure the opponent's life total and close out the game quickly.

The key concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and other aggressive creatures like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Spyglass Siren are meant to apply pressure to the opponent quickly. Brazen Borrower provides versatility as a creature or a tempo play, while Faerie Miscreant and Floodpits Drowner allow for card advantage. The deck aims to maintain a steady offensive presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful Overlord creatures and control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. It also utilizes Leyline Binding and Nowhere to Run to disrupt opponents' strategies. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and other powerful creatures like Linvala, the Preserver provide additional threats and utility. The deck's mana base is built to support the variety of colors required for its cards, ensuring consistency in casting spells and controlling the game.

This deck focuses on a fast, aggressive strategy utilizing goblins to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Conspicuous Snoop and Goblin Chainwhirler, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Call of the Death-Dweller provide removal options and ways to recur key creatures. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for the deck to function smoothly. Overall, this deck is all about swift aggression and maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to utilize a combination of creature sacrifice effects, graveyard recursion, and mana ramp to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on generating value from sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Ygra, Eater of All, while also utilizing cards like Gilded Goose and Vinereap Mentor for mana acceleration. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay.

This deck focuses on combining creatures with powerful abilities like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a dominating board presence. It also utilizes cards like Raffine's Informant and Say Its Name to search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse help control the board while cards like Grisly Salvage and Traverse the Ulvenwald provide card advantage and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and synergy.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. The deck includes cards that allow for rapid creature growth and efficient mana usage, along with pump spells and combat tricks to push through damage. With a mix of early-game threats and resilient creatures, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile lands and support spells helps ensure a steady flow of threats and options throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Questing Druid, supported by spells like Atarka's Command and Play with Fire. The deck also includes cards like Snakeskin Veil to protect its creatures and Boseiju, Who Endures to make its spells uncounterable. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's game plan. The goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on fast creature drops and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent, with a particular emphasis on using Monstrous Rage to pump up creatures and deal additional damage. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for extra mana ramp to ensure quick plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures like Adeline, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Coppercoat Vanguard, supported by disruption from cards like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar. Collected Company is used to quickly find and deploy additional creatures, while High Noon provides a powerful combat trick. The mana base is designed to support the multiple colors needed for the deck, with Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory helping cast the various Human creatures efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient army of creatures.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures and gaining value from their deaths. By utilizing cards like Mayhem Devil, Cauldron Familiar, and Witch's Oven, this deck aims to deal damage to the opponent while also generating additional resources. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Ygra, Eater of All further amplifies the deck's aggression and resource generation capabilities. With a strong mana base and removal options like Fatal Push, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing sacrifice effects to gain advantage on the board. The key strategy involves using Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to generate food tokens, which can be sacrificed for various effects like dealing damage with Mayhem Devil or drawing cards with Deadly Dispute. Ygra, Eater of All acts as a powerful threat that can be cast for its alternate cost by sacrificing creatures. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Scavenger's Talent to control the opponent's board while building up its own army.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and generating value through sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and using Witch's Oven. It also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board. The addition of Ygra, Eater of All allows for a powerful late-game threat. The mana base supports the aggressive nature of the deck with a mix of fast lands, shock lands, and pathways. The companion choice of Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck.

The deck focuses on using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and combo off. Cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings help untap Lotus Field to generate even more mana. Dig Through Time and Pore Over the Pages provide card selection and draw power, while Lier, Disciple of the Drowned helps recur important spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes some interaction in the form of Lightning Strike and Bala Ged Recovery to deal with threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field as a key piece for generating a large amount of mana quickly. By using cards like Sleight of Hand, Hidden Strings, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, the deck aims to untap Lotus Field multiple times in a turn to generate huge amounts of mana. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells like Dig Through Time and Wish to find and play win conditions like Lier, Disciple of the Drowned. The deck also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library to ensure consistent draws and access to the combo pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells such as Dig Through Time and Pore Over the Pages. The key concept is to leverage cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field multiple times, allowing for explosive turns that can lead to victory through card advantage and overwhelming board presence. The deck also includes ways to search for key pieces and protect itself, ensuring that the combo can be assembled consistently and effectively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a wide range of cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up card advantage through the use of Niv-Mizzet Reborn. The deck also includes powerful multicolor cards to provide versatility and flexibility in different matchups. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker allows for additional value and card draw, while the composition of lands ensures a consistent mana base to support the deck's diverse range of spells. Overall, the key concept revolves around maintaining control of the game and outmaneuvering the opponent with a mix of disruption and powerful threats.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the game. Key cards such as Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester provide strong threats, while Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan. Unholy Annex/Ritual Chamber allow for mana fixing and acceleration, while Fatal Push and Go for the Throat provide removal options. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board through a combination of creature aggression and disruption spells.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while efficiently dealing with threats using removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck aims to apply early pressure with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni, supported by the powerful recursion provided by Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production.

This aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by instant buff spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage. Thoughtseize is used for disruption, while Slickshot Show-Off helps with direct damage. The deck also includes burn spells like Claim / Fame and Reckless Rage for removal. The mana base is optimized for fast, consistent plays with dual lands and utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins. Jegantha, the Wellspring is included as a companion for additional ramp and flexibility.

This Red Deck Wins deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells like Skewer the Critics, Play with Fire, and Wizard's Lightning, as well as utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to apply pressure. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Hazoret the Fervent to close out games. With a strong focus on aggression and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and consistent damage output.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful synergy between the Relic of Legends enchantment and Acererak the Archlich to generate value and assemble a game-winning combo. The deck includes a mix of creatures and support cards to control the battlefield and set up the combo, with cards like Collected Company, Kinnan, Bonder Prodigy, and Gwenna, Eyes of Gaea helping to accelerate the strategy. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional flexibility as a companion. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck while ensuring consistency and efficiency.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing efficient creatures with disruptive abilities. The creatures in the deck have abilities that hinder opponents' plays and slow down their game plan, giving the player an advantage in combat. By playing creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' spells and slow down their development, while also being able to quickly apply pressure through early drops like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves. The deck also includes cards like Skyclave Apparition and Elite Spellbinder to further disrupt opponents' game plan and maintain board control. Ultimately, the goal of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a combination of disruptive creatures and efficient beaters to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using counterspells like Dovin's Veto and removal spells like Portable Hole. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and The Wandering Emperor, while drawing cards and generating advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Memory Deluge. The mana base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Hallowed Fountain to support the control strategy. Ultimately, the goal of the deck is to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until the win condition can be established.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own win conditions. It aims to establish board control through cards like Supreme Verdict and Portable Hole, while also generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Memory Deluge. The inclusion of Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon provides powerful win conditions, while the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard offers additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents with a combination of control and card advantage.

The main strategy of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. The deck utilizes a variety of control spells like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict to keep the opponent's board in check, while cards like Three Steps Ahead and Omen of the Sea provide card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB triggers. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by maintaining control of the game until victory.
